universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable

Class CircularProgressDrawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.graphics.drawable.Drawable
      • universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable.ProgressDrawable
        • universum.studios.android.ui.graphics.drawable.CircularProgressDrawable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animatable

    public class CircularProgressDrawable
extends ProgressDrawable
    A ProgressDrawable implementation which draws a progress or an indeterminate graphics as circular (oval) shape. Size of the oval can be specified by setRadius(int) and its thickness can be specified by ProgressDrawable.setThickness(float). Note, that as any drawable implementation also this drawable will draw its graphics into bounds set by Drawable.setBounds(int, int, int, int), the radius set to this drawable is only for informational purpose for a View which hosts this drawable to determine how much space is needed to draw graphics of this drawable. The required size can be obtained by getIntrinsicWidth() and getIntrinsicHeight().

    The oval's color can be specified by ProgressDrawable.setColor(int) or ProgressDrawable.setColors(int[]) where the specified set of colors will be used only in case of indeterminate mode. See description for MODE_INDETERMINATE below for more info. This progress drawable can also draw its background of which color can be specified by ProgressDrawable.setBackgroundColor(int). The background is drawn as a full progress oval with the specified thickness.

    Whether to draw the progress or indeterminate graphics can be specified by setting a mode by setMode(int). The supported modes for this progress drawable class are described below.

    Modes

    • MODE_DETERMINATE

      A determinate mode should be used when an instance of CircularProgressDrawable should draw value of progress specified by ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int). The specified progress will be transformed into degrees value and than drawn as oval. A start angle of the progress oval can be specified by setStartAngle(float), the default one is at 270 degrees, so at 12 a clock. When a max progress is set to the CircularProgressDrawable the full progress oval => circle is drawn.

      This mode supports auto-rotation feature of the progress oval and this feature is by default enabled, so whenever ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int) is called, the progress oval will be rotated clockwise by degrees delta (NEW_ANGLE - OLD_ANGLE). This rotation logic will ensures hat a tail and a head of the progress oval will be meeting (before they collapse) at the start angle.

      Note, that calls like ProgressDrawable.start(), ProgressDrawable.stop() are for this mode ignored.

    • MODE_INDETERMINATE

      An indeterminate mode should be used when an instance of CircularProgressDrawable should draw the indeterminate graphics. The indeterminate graphics drawing is implemented as infinite amount of consecutive loops, where each of these loops is consisted of progressive expanding followed by progressive collapsing of the oval. This is, for purpose of the CircularProgressDrawable, called as described in class overview of ProgressDrawable indeterminate animation session. During this animation session is the oval also progressively rotated.

      The animation session can be started by ProgressDrawable.start() and stopped by ProgressDrawable.stop() or ProgressDrawable.stopImmediate(). The difference between those two stop methods is that if requested to not stop immediately via stop(), the drawing of the indeterminate graphics will be stopped after the oval is fully collapsed otherwise will be stopped immediately regardless how much is the oval expanded/collapsed so it will look like it just "vanished".

      This mode supports multi-coloring feature which can be enabled by ProgressDrawable.setMultiColored(boolean). If this feature is enabled, the set of colors specified by ProgressDrawable.setColors(int[]) will be used to change color of the oval whenever the indeterminate oval is fully collapsed. If the end of the colors array is reached, the next color will be picked again from the beginning of the array and so on.

      Note, that calls like ProgressDrawable.setProgress(int), setRotation(float) are for this mode ignored.

    Arrow

    An arrow feature can be enabled by setArrowEnabled(boolean) for both MODE_DETERMINATE and MODE_INDETERMINATE modes. If enabled, the arrow is drawn at the head of the progress/indeterminate oval. This feature can be useful for refresh drawable. Enabling of this feature also changes (expands) size of the CircularProgressDrawable, so the radius specified by setRadius(int) will be preserved. Size of the arrow unfortunately cannot be specified, but its size will be computed according to the current thickness of the oval to ensure that the arrow's appearance will fit to the whole progress drawable's appearance properly. The arrow can be also scaled up/down by setArrowScale(float) which can be used to progressively show/hide the arrow.

    Rotating

    The progress oval can be also rotated (supported only for MODE_DETERMINATE) by setRotation(float). This method is used for the auto-rotation feature described for determinate mode above.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

        Overrides:

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(@Px
                      int radius)
        Sets the radius for the progress/indeterminate oval of this progress drawable. If the arrow feature is enabled by setArrowEnabled(boolean), the size of this drawable will be defined by the radius and also by size of the arrow. If arrow is not enabled size of this drawable will be radius * 2 for both width and height of which values can be obtained by getIntrinsicWidth() and getIntrinsicHeight().

        Default radius is: -1

        Parameters:
        radius - The desired radius.
        See Also:
        getRadius()

      • getRadius

        @Px
public int getRadius()
        Returns the radius of the progress/indeterminate oval of this progress drawable.

        Note, that as described in setRadius(int), the radius does not necessarily specify size of this drawable.

        Returns:
        This drawable's progress/indeterminate oval's radius.
        See Also:
        setRadius(int)

      • getIntrinsicWidth

        public int getIntrinsicWidth()
        Returns (radius * 2) if the arrow feature is not enabled, (radius * 2 + arrowOverflow) if it is enabled.
        Overrides:
        getIntrinsicWidth in class Drawable

      • getIntrinsicHeight

        public int getIntrinsicHeight()
        Returns (radius * 2) if the arrow feature is not enabled, (radius * 2 + arrowOverflow) if it is enabled.
        Overrides:
        getIntrinsicHeight in class Drawable

      • setStartAngle

        public void setStartAngle(float startAngle)
        Sets the initial start angle for the progress/indeterminate oval.

        If in INDETERMINATE mode the specified start angle will be applied after the running indeterminate animation sessions is finished. If in DETERMINATE mode the specified angle will be immediately applied so it should be set before the progress updates starts.

        The default start angle is: 270

        Parameters:
        startAngle - The desired angle from the range [0, 360].
        See Also:
        getStartAngle()

      • getStartAngle

        public float getStartAngle()
        Returns the initial start angle for the progress/indeterminate oval of this progress drawable.
        Returns:
        Initial start angle from the range [0, 360].
        See Also:
        setStartAngle(float)

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Description copied from class: ProgressDrawable
        Changes mode of this progress drawable. The progress mode specifies behaviour and drawing of this drawable and its progress.

        Note, that changing the current mode will not affect in any way currently running animation session, just drawing behaviour of the progress/indeterminate graphics. This means, that changing mode to for example INDETERMINATE will not start indeterminate animation session by ProgressDrawable.start(), this is responsibility of the user (view) of this drawable to start or stop animations properly. This is due to performance, so changing mode will not start animations at time when the view which hosts this drawable is not attached to window yet.

        Overrides:
        setMode in class ProgressDrawable
        Parameters:
        mode - A flag of the desired mode.
        See Also:
        ProgressDrawable.getMode()

      • getMode

        public int getMode()
        Description copied from class: ProgressDrawable
        Returns the current mode of this progress drawable set by ProgressDrawable.setMode(int).
        Overrides:
        getMode in class ProgressDrawable
        Returns:
        Current mode.
        See Also:
        ProgressDrawable.setMode(int)

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(float rotation)
        Sets the rotation for the progress oval of this progress drawable. The specified rotation will be applied only if the current mode is DETERMINATE.

        This method will update both the start and sweep angle of the progress oval. If the arrow feature is enabled, the arrow position will be also updated.

        Parameters:
        rotation - The desired rotation from the range [0, 360].
        See Also:
        getRotation()

      • getRotation

        public float getRotation()
        Returns the rotation of the progress oval.
        Returns:
        Current progress oval's rotation from the range [0, 360] or 0 if the current mode is not DETERMINATE.
        See Also:
        setRotation(float)

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • isArrowVisible

        public boolean isArrowVisible()

        Returns:
        True if the arrow is drawn, false otherwise.
        See Also:

      • setArrowEnabled

        public void setArrowEnabled(boolean hasArrow)
        Sets a flag indicating whether the arrow feature for this progress drawable should be enabled or not.

        If the arrow feature is enabled, the arrow is drawn at the head of the current progress/indeterminate oval. The arrow feature is not tied to the current mode. Note, that if the arrow is enabled, size (width and height) of this progress drawable will expand by size of the arrow.

        The arrow feature is disabled by default.

        Parameters:
        hasArrow - True to enable arrow feature, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isArrowEnabled()

      • isArrowEnabled

        public boolean isArrowEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the arrow feature is enabled for this progress drawable or not.
        Returns:
        True if the arrow feature is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setArrowEnabled(boolean)

      • setArrowScale

        public void setArrowScale(float scale)
        Sets the scale for the arrow of this progress drawable.

        This can be useful when the arrow need to be progressively shown or hidden.

        Parameters:
        scale - The desired scale from the range [0, 1].
        See Also:
        getArrowScale()

      • getArrowScale

        public float getArrowScale()
        Returns the current scale of the arrow.
        Returns:
        Arrow's current scale.
        See Also:
        setArrowScale(float)

      • setRotateOnProgressChangeEnabled

        public void setRotateOnProgressChangeEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets a flag indicating whether to auto-rotate the progress oval after a change in progress occurs or not.

        This feature is supported only for DETERMINATE mode and if enabled the progress oval will be rotated in such a way that when it is at its max value defined by ProgressDrawable.setMax(int), both the tail and the head of the progress oval will meet at the 12 a clock.

        This feature is enabled by default.

        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable this feature, false to disable it.
        See Also:
        isRotateOnProgressChangeEnabled()

      • isRotateOnProgressChangeEnabled

        public boolean isRotateOnProgressChangeEnabled()
        Returns a flag indicating whether to auto-rotate the progress oval whenever a change in progress occurs in DETERMINATE mode.
        Returns:
        True if auto-rotation is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setRotateOnProgressChangeEnabled(boolean)

        protected void onDrawBackground(@NonNull
                                Canvas canvas,
                                @NonNull
                                Paint paint,
                                @Nullable
                                ColorFilter colorFilter)
        Description copied from class: ProgressDrawable
        Invoked whenever ProgressDrawable.draw(android.graphics.Canvas) is called for this progress drawable and there is background color set and its alpha value is not 0.

        Note, that any color filter set to the given paint will be clear after this call.

        Overrides:
        onDrawBackground in class ProgressDrawable
        Parameters:

        paint - A paint that can be used for drawing operations. This paint has already tint filter specified, based on ProgressDrawable.setBackgroundTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) and ProgressDrawable.setBackgroundTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode) parameters.
        colorFilter - Color filter obtained from the specified paint.
